RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SISTER SPIRIT raced near the back around the first turn then moved up from three or four wide down the backstretch and dueled down the stretch with the leader, edged away to prove best. WICKED SAUCY pressed the pace from the two path around the first turn then took the lead nearing the half pole, was challenged rounding the final turn and dueled down the stretch to be a game second. LOOKING FOR FLARE had good foot early then settled off the pace around the first turn, moved between horses entering the final turn and gave late effort to be up for the show. DESTINED TO DANCE was allowed to settle around the first turn then launched a bid at the three eighths pole to improve position but was empty. CHANTILLY MOON (PER) stalked the pace from the two path then moved up inside of rival down the backstretch and faltered. COWGIRL HOP trailed the field to the top of the stretch and passed tiring rivals. ALWAYS FORWARD tracked the leaders to midway down the backstretch then made a mild bid into the turn and tired. MY BEST GIRL went to a pressured lead to the half pole then vied for a furlong and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: My Best Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressured lead, vied, retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Cowgirl Hop
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, passed tiring rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Always Forward
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, mild bid, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Looking for Flare
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, late effort, up show

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Saucy
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, took lead 1/2p, stretch duel, game second

ENTRY.NAME: Chantilly Moon (PER)
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, move up backstretch, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, 3-4w backstretch, stretch duel, best

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Wasabi Ventures Stables, LLC, Connie S.Black, Kyle Scribne

ENTRY.NAME: Destined to Dance
ENTRY.OWNER: Corrales Racing LLC and Corrales Maria V
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, bid 3/8p, empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 21800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE MAY 27, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 27 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEVER COMPROMISE stalked the pace around the first turn then made a bid at the half pole to share command to midway through the final turn, edged away and drew clear. GOLDEN APPEAL raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a three wide bid entering the final turn to make a late run to be second best. AUBURN MILL was slightly fractious in the gate, then was hustled along to press the pace from the inside to the three eighths pole, made a rebid on the final turn to be up for the show. THEWITCHISGONE was off the pace around the first turn then made a bid at the half pole to share command through the final turn and gave way. SARGENT KOBE remained back. BRIGHT DAWN trailed the field and was never a factor. GRAND FIBER went to a challenged lead to the three eighths pole and was done. A JOCKEY OBJECTION WAS POSTED, THE JOCKEY OF GOLDEN APPEAL CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE JOCKEY OF NEVER COMPROMISE FOR ALLEGED INTERFERNCE LEAVING THE STARTING GATE, AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW THE CLAIM OF FOUL WAS DISSALLOWED AND NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: Bright Dawn
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Sargent Kobe
ENTRY.COMMENT: remained back

ENTRY.NAME: Auburn Mill
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, rebid, up show

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Fiber
ENTRY.COMMENT: challenged lead, headed 3/8p, done

ENTRY.NAME: Thewitchisgone
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, bid 1/2p, shared command, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Appeal
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pace, 3w bid, late run, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Never Compromise
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, shared command, edged away, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Claiming Purse 18500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FANEUIL HALL stalked the pace through the final turn then made a three wide bid in upper stretch and moved between horses in the final sixteenth, dug in and won the nod. TAKE AIM raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a two wide bid on the final turn, moved out to four wide in upper stretch and was a hard fought second. MAJOR NELSON was unhurried down the backstretch then made a three wide bid on the final turn and moved out to five wide in the stretch for a late rally. MIMS SECOND CHANCE was hustled to the lead and was over taken at the five sixteenths pole but fought gamely to deep stretch then drifted in and was out finished. HAY DIDDLE DIDDLE was off the pace around the first turn then moved out to four wide at the half pole and took the lead at the five sixteenths pole but was impeded in the final sixteenth and had to check late. MR MAJESTIC was allowed to settle down the backstretch then made a rail bid on the final turn but was not a factor. COLONEL CAPPY vied for the lead to the three eighth pole and gave way. TOTHETRAINSTATION was always back. A JOCKEY OBJECTION WAS LODGED, THE JOCKEY OF HAY DIDDLE DIDDLE CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE JOCKEY OF MIMS SECOND CHANCE FOR INTERFERENCE AT THE SIXTEENTH POLE, AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW, THE CLAIM OF FOUL WAS ALLOWED AND MIMS SECOND CHANCE WAS DISQUALIFIED FROM FOURTH TO FIFTH FOR DRIFTING IN AND IMPEDING WITH HAY DIDDLE DIDLE.

ENTRY.NAME: Hay Diddle Diddle
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w 1/2p, took over 5/16p, impeded, checked

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Majestic
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, rail bid, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Major Nelson
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, 3w 2nd turn, 5w stretch, late rally

ENTRY.NAME: Colonel Cappy
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Tothetrainstation
ENTRY.COMMENT: always back

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Mims Second Chance
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead, over taken, fought gamely, drift in, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Faneuil Hall
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 3w upper, between 1/16, dug in, won nod

ENTRY.NAME: Take Aim
ENTRY.OWNER: Jones Jr Michael E and JKX Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 2w bid, 4w upper, hard fought 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 27 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15 ,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUDDY BUDDY was hustled to the lead into the first turn then was headed at the five sixteenths pole, dueled to the wire and won the nod. SPANGLISH was off the pace in the two path around the first turn then engaged the leader at the five sixteenths pole and matched strides to the wire but was denied. MINISTRY OF MAGIC was unhurried down the backstretch then launched a bid from three wide at the quarter pole, moved out to four wide in upper stretch to make a late rally for the show. PENGUIN PARADE stalked the pace around the first turn then made a four wide bid at the three eighths pole to vie for the lead around the final turn but was out kicked late. BOSS E BOOGS never fired. REMYS SHOWTIME tracked the leaders around the first turn then tried to move between horses after the three eighths pole but was in tight and had to be taken up and couldn't recover.

ENTRY.NAME: Ministry of Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, bid 3w 1/4p, 4w upper, rallied for show

ENTRY.NAME: Remys Showtime
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, in tight 3/8, taken up, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Penguin Parade
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 4w 3/8p, vied for lead, out kicked late

ENTRY.NAME: Boss E Boogs
ENTRY.COMMENT: never fired

ENTRY.NAME: Buddy Buddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead, headed 5/16p, dueled, won nod

ENTRY.NAME: Spanglish
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, engaged leader, dueled, denied

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 15200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 27, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since November 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RED QUEEN tracked the leader around the first turn then moved between horses to take the lead at the three eighths pole then was challenged in late stretch but was able to hold on for the win. SHINY PENNY was in tight going into the first turn then raced within striking distance from three wide, moved out to six wide in upper stretch to make a late run and matched strides with the leader but was denied. CLEARLY VISIBLE raced in the middle of the pack around the first turn then move up to go between horses at the five sixteenths pole but lost her path and steadied slightly, made a rebid and split horses at the eighth pole and held the show. CHINA CAT trailed down the backstretch then made a two wide bid going into the final turn and maneuvered through traffic around that turn and rallied to just miss the show. DON'T TELL GRANDMA went four wide into the first turn then rushed up to vie for the lead from three wide through the final turn and tired. SAX stalked the pace from four wide then made a bid on the final turn and weakened. DAT DARES GOLD was close up on the inside down the backstretch then tried to move up but lacked room on the final turn, moved out to four wide in the stretch but had no late kick. SWEET ANNABELLA remained back. SUPER WILDCAT was rushed to the lead around the first turn then was over taken a the three eighths pole and slowly faded. A JOCKEY OBJECTION WAS LODGED, THE JOCKEY OF SHINY PENNY CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE JOCKEY OF RED QUEEN FOR ALLEGED INTERFERENCE GOING INTO THE CLUBHOUSE TURN, AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW THE CLAIM OF FOUL WAS DISALLOWED AND NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: China Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, 2w turn, traffic, rallied, missed show

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Annabella
ENTRY.COMMENT: remained back

ENTRY.NAME: Clearly Visible
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle pack, between 5/16, lost path, split horses, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Dat Dares Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up, inside, lacked room, 4w stretch, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Sax
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 4w, bid turn, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Shiny Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight 1st turn, striking distance, 6w upper, late run, denied

ENTRY.NAME: Super Wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, over taken 3/8p, slow faded

ENTRY.NAME: Red Queen
ENTRY.OWNER: Honoring Luke Stables and Kenworthy John C
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, between, took lead 3/8p, duel, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Tell Grandma
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w 1st turn, rushed up, vied for lead, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 84. Starter Allowance Purse 20700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE MAY 27, 2021. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 27 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIVINE FASHION was forwardly placed down the backstretch then made a three wide bid on the final turn to give a late kick to just get up for the win. ACADIAN GIRL vied for the lead from the two path down the backstretch then match strides with the leader around the final turn and inched away going into the stretch but couldn't fend off the late closer. KALENJIN was allowed to settle around the first turn then launched a two wide bid at the three eighths pole and was gaining on the leader around the final turn, tipped out to three wide in upper stretch and flattened out. FLOATING BY race near the back around the first turn then made a two wide bid at the quarter pole for a late run to improve position. MY JUBA went to the front to set the pace, was challenged going into the final turn and matched strides with outside rival to top of stretch and tired. TEQUILA FOG chased the leader but was not a factor. SHERIFF'S KID was not a threat. TAPPING SOUTH trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: My Juba
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, match stride 2nd turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Acadian Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, match strides, inched away, couldn't fend

ENTRY.NAME: Sheriff's Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Divine Fashion
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, 3w bid, late kick, just up

ENTRY.NAME: Tequila Fog
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Kalenjin
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 2w3/8p, gaining, 3w stretch, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Floating By
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, 2w1/4p, late run, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Tapping South
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed throughout

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 27 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Consider ed In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S HOUSE tracked the leader through the turn then made a three wide late run to be up in final jump. FANCY HER UP sprinted to a clear lead to deep stretch and was nailed at the wire. SNOWY JUBA CAT chased the leader and never made a bid. FAST MULE had no early speed then moved up from three wide on the turn and improved position. SISTER JOANN raced back early then moved between horses at the three eighths pole but failed to menace. KILBRITTAIN'S RED split horses early to be off the pace to the to the turn and retreated. CEDAR'S WISH was restless in the gate then was last away and never a factor. EMBERLY had brief foot then had to check early and dropped back.

ENTRY.NAME: Emberly
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief foot, checked early, dropped back

ENTRY.NAME: Cedar's Wish
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Joann
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, between horses, failed to menace

ENTRY.NAME: Fancy Her Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Kilbrittain's Red
ENTRY.COMMENT: split horses, off pace, retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Snowy Juba Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leader, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Juba's House
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, 3w late run, just up

ENTRY.NAME: Fast Mule
ENTRY.OWNER: Bone Robert D and Brown Edward Rusty J
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, moved up 3w, improved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IRISH SAMURAI raced near the back around the first turn then advanced from three or four wide through the final turn and collared the leaders at the eighth pole and drew clear late. JACCACI trailed the field around the first turn then moved up the rail down the backstretch, moved around horses on the turn then split horses at the top of the stretch and prove second best. SPUNKY ZOEY bumped foe going into the first turn but kept on to be off the pace on the inside, moved up to engage the leader at the three sixteenths pole and took a brief lead and tired. SUPERSNAKE was rushed up from three wide to take the lead at the half pole then was collared at the three sixteenths pole and tired. FORT ZANNA was unhurried down the backstretch then moved out to three wide at the quarter pole and improved position. SHESAHUMBLEHUSTLER was allowed to settle down the backstretch then made a rail bid at the quarter pole, moved out to three or four wide in upper stretch and made a late run to improve position. RIGHT TO ASSEMBLE was bumped going into the first turn then advanced to contention from three wide down the backstretch but flattened out in the drive. PRETTY SPECTACULAR was close up on the leaders around the first turn then dropped back. CURLIN'S DOVE went to the early lead around the first turn then tracked the leader down the backstretch and gave way. C TWO was hustled away from the gate to vie for the lead to the half pole and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Jaccaci
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, moved up rail, split horses, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Right to Assemble
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped early, 3w advance, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Spunky Zoey
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped early, off pace, engaged 3/16p, brief lead, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Shesahumblehustler
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, rail bid 1/4p, 3-4w upper, late interest

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin's Dove
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead, tracked leader, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Pretty Spectacular
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up early, dropped back

ENTRY.NAME: C Two
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled away, vied for lead, retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Zanna
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, 3w 1/4p, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Supersnake
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up 3w, led 1/2p, collared 3/16p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Samurai
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, moved up 3-4w, collared leader 1/8p, drew clear late
